Pharmacist Job at the NSIA-LUTH Cancer Center (NLCC)




        
    

        
        The NSIA-LUTH Cancer Center (NLCC) is West Africa’s most renowned center dedicated solely to offering premium cancer care, research, education and prevention. Our aesthetic facility stands distinct within the walls of the prestigious Lagos University Teaching Hospital and boasts of world class, state-of-the-art equipment and facilities that deliver international standard Cancer care in a comfortable and safe environment. Our Clinical team comprises of highly skilled and experienced in-house Clinical and Radiation Oncologists, Oncology Nurses and other multidisciplinary specialists with a proven track record of excellence in clinical leadership and expertise in the field of Oncology.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Pharmacist

Job Location: Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualification and experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: recruitment@nlcc.ng using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the email.

Note
The Curriculum vitae should contain the following:


	Full Name
	Date of Birth
	Qualification
	Position applied for
	First & Second choice work location
	Functioning Email Address
	Active phone number.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at Honour Flow Group of Companies
content:
Honour Flow Group of Companies (HFGC) is a group of companies with several subsidiaries and varieties of products available to customers. These subsidiaries include: a huge warehouse where codiment, eateries, bakery, water factory, juice, ice block,gas station, filling station, and a microfinance bank. We deliver our products across Nigeria, timely.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) General Manager

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The General Manager is responsible for providing overall leadership, strategic direction, and operational oversight for the factory’s multiple units – bakery, water, ice cream, ice block, and juice production.
	This role ensures optimal production efficiency, product quality, regulatory compliance, and profitability while maintaining a safe, productive, and motivated workforce.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership & Planning:


	Develop and implement operational strategies for all production units (bakery, water, ice cream, ice block, juice) to meet business goals.
	Prepare annual production plans, budgets, and resource allocation for optimal performance.
	Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, reduce cost, and maximize output.


Production & Operations Management:


	Oversee day-to-day production activities, ensuring targets are met on quality, quantity, and timelines.
	Monitor equipment utilization and schedule maintenance to minimize downtime.
	Ensure proper raw material planning, inventory control, and waste reduction across units.
	Establish and enforce production SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) to ensure consistency.


Quality Assurance & Compliance:


	Implement and monitor quality control systems across all product lines.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and regulatory standards (NAFDAC, SON, environmental laws).
	Conduct periodic inspections and audits to maintain product quality and plant hygiene.


Financial & Cost Control:


	Monitor operational costs and identify opportunities for savings without compromising quality.
	Prepare monthly performance reports including production volumes, cost variances, and profitability.
	Ensure accurate stock-taking and reconciliation with finance and store departments.


People Management & Development:


	Lead, motivate, and supervise plant managers, supervisors, and staff across all production lines.
	Develop and implement training programs to improve staff competency and performance.
	Resolve employee relations issues and promote a culture of teamwork, accountability, and safety.


Health, Safety & Environment (HSE):


	Ensure strict adherence to workplace safety standards and procedures.
	Champion a safe work culture and organize regular safety drills and HSE training.
	Investigate incidents/accidents and implement corrective and preventive actions.


Stakeholder & External Relations:


	Liaise with suppliers, regulatory authorities, and key partners to ensure smooth operations.
	Represent the factory management in company meetings and strategic planning sessions.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Achievement of monthly/annual production targets.
	Reduction in downtime and operational costs.
	Improvement in product quality ratings and compliance scores.
	Employee productivity, retention, and engagement levels.
	Safety record (zero lost-time accidents).
	Profitability and cost efficiency of each production line.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Management, Food Science, Engineering, or related field (MBA preferred).
	7–10 years of  experience in manufacturing management, preferably in FMCG/food & beverage sector.
	Strong leadership, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent knowledge of production planning, process optimization, and quality management systems.
	Proficiency in MS Office and ERP systems.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: honourflowgroupofcompanies@gmail.com using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the email.

Note: For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 07014335204.

 

 

2.) Auditor

Job Location: Ughelli, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Warehouse Auditor is responsible for monitoring, reviewing, and verifying all warehouse activities to ensure accuracy, compliance with company policies, and proper safeguarding of inventory.
	This role focuses on auditing stock movement, documentation, and operational processes to detect discrepancies, prevent losses, and support sound decision-making.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory & Stock Audits:


	Conduct regular (daily/weekly/monthly) physical stock counts and reconcile with system records.
	Investigate discrepancies between physical stock and warehouse records, recommending corrective actions.
	Audit receipts of goods (raw materials, finished goods) and verify against delivery notes, invoices, and GRNs.
	Check stock handling, storage conditions, and shelf-life compliance.


Process & Documentation Review:


	Audit goods issuance process (dispatch, loading, delivery) for accuracy and compliance.
	Verify correctness of warehouse documentation including bin cards, stock registers, issue notes, and returns.
	Review and approve write-offs, damaged goods reports, and stock adjustments after investigation.


Compliance & Policy Enforcement:


	Ensure adherence to warehouse SOPs, inventory control policies, and company guidelines.
	Monitor warehouse security practices to minimize pilferage, theft, and unauthorized stock movement.
	Check compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations within the warehouse.


Reporting & Recommendations:


	Prepare detailed audit reports highlighting variances, risks, and process gaps.
	Recommend corrective actions and follow up on implementation by warehouse management.
	Provide periodic summary reports to management on stock accuracy and risk exposure.


Risk Management & Loss Prevention


	Identify weaknesses in warehouse operations that may lead to financial or material loss.
	Collaborate with storekeepers, warehouse supervisors, and finance to implement controls.
	Monitor high-value or fast-moving items closely to prevent stock shrinkage.


Continuous Improvement


	Suggest process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy in warehouse operations.
	Support training of warehouse staff on proper documentation, handling, and compliance practices.
	Track audit findings and ensure they are closed within agreed timelines.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of stock count vs. system records (variance percentage).
	Timeliness and completeness of audit reports.
	Reduction in stock discrepancies and write-offs.
	Compliance rate with warehouse SOPs and company policies.
	Implementation rate of audit recommendations.


Qualifications & Skills


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2 - 4 years of experience in warehouse auditing, inventory control, or internal audit.
	Strong knowledge of warehouse processes, stock accounting, and ERP/inventory systems.
	Excellent analytical and investigative skills.
	High attention to detail, integrity, and objectivity.
	Good communication and reporting skills.


Application Closing Date: 24th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: honourflowgroupofcompanies@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For inquiries, send a WhatsApp message to: 07014335204.

 

3.) Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Ughelli, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Warehouse Marketer is responsible for driving product sales directly from the warehouse, ensuring customers are properly attended to, and supporting the distribution of goods.
	This role combines marketing, customer service, and light inventory coordination to achieve sales targets and maintain smooth warehouse operations.


Key Responsibilities
Sales & Marketing:


	Promote and sell company products (bread, water, ice cream, ice block, juice, etc.) to walk-in and wholesale customers.
	Maintain strong relationships with customers to encourage repeat business.
	Provide product information, prices, and promotional offers to boost sales.
	Track and achieve daily, weekly, and monthly sales targets.


Customer Engagement & Service:


	Attend to customers promptly and professionally at the warehouse.
	Receive and process customer orders, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
	Handle customer complaints or escalate them to the supervisor when necessary.


Warehouse Support:


	Coordinate with storekeeper/warehouse staff to ensure product availability.
	Monitor stock levels of fast-moving items and report shortages to the supervisor.
	Ensure products are well-arranged and displayed for easy access and good presentation.


Record Keeping & Reporting:


	Maintain accurate sales records, invoices, and receipts for all transactions.
	Submit daily sales reports to the Marketing Manager or Accountant.
	Track credit sales (if any) and follow up on payments with approval.


Market Intelligence & Feedback:


	Gather feedback from customers on product quality, pricing, and market trends.
	Report competitor activities, price changes, or promotions to the management.
	Recommend strategies to attract new customers and retain existing ones.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Achievement of daily/weekly/monthly sales targets.
	Customer satisfaction and retention levels.
	Accuracy and timeliness of sales records.
	Reduction in customer complaints and product returns.
	Contribution to warehouse orderliness and stock accuracy.


Qualifications & Skills


	OND / NCE or equivalent in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 1 – 3 years of experience in marketing, sales, or warehouse operations.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet targets.
	Basic knowledge of inventory management and record keeping.
	Good numeracy and negotiation skills.


Application Closing Date: 14th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and and portfolio of past social media work to: Ifeoluwamorakinyo@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For inquiries, call: 07014335204.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Senior Civil Engineer",
  "description": "Sales People Nigeria Limited was officially incorporated on the 25th of May, 2010 and is a Major innovative player in the Real estate, Construction and management. The underlying vision was birthed by the desire to provide clients with total solutions in the marketing industry of real estate and later diverted its resources in providing construction services to clients. With our Head Office in Abuja, our goal is to be key providers of fully integrated designs and construction solutions as we also specialize in the construction, maintenance, Marketing, Consultancy and management of real estate development.

Through our vast experience and best-in class approach, we identify and implement solutions that create net value and thereby giving us the opportunity to convey our services to our teeming clients in class and style.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Civil Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking to hire three (3) experienced Civil Engineers to join our growing team in Abuja. We&rsquo;re looking for highly skilled professionals with over 10 years of hands-on experience in real estate and construction projects.
	Candidates must be COREN certified and possess a strong background in structural designs, project supervision, and site coordination.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage end-to-end construction projects from design to execution.
	Review and validate structural designs and drawings.
	Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress and ensure adherence to design specifications, safety standards, and quality control.
	Supervise contractors, subcontractors, and labor teams to ensure timely delivery of projects.
	Prepare technical reports, BOQs, and cost estimates.
	Liaise with architects, quantity surveyors, and project managers to align project objectives and resolve issues.
	Ensure strict compliance with COREN, Nigerian building codes, and industry best practices.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Civil Engineering from a recognized institution.
	Minimum of 10 years of post-graduation working experience in construction or real estate.
	COREN certification is mandatory.
	Proficiency in structural design software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, STAAD Pro, etc.).
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Proven track record of successfully completed commercial or residential building projects.
	Applicant must be resident in FCT, Abuja.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified&nbsp;candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;careers@salespeoplenigerialtd.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Senior Civil Engineer Job at Sales People Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Sales People Nigeria Limited was officially incorporated on the 25th of May, 2010 and is a Major innovative player in the Real estate, Construction and management. The underlying vision was birthed by the desire to provide clients with total solutions in the marketing industry of real estate and later diverted its resources in providing construction services to clients. With our Head Office in Abuja, our goal is to be key providers of fully integrated designs and construction solutions as we also specialize in the construction, maintenance, Marketing, Consultancy and management of real estate development.
     

            
    



Through our vast experience and best-in class approach, we identify and implement solutions that create net value and thereby giving us the opportunity to convey our services to our teeming clients in class and style.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Civil Engineer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking to hire three (3) experienced Civil Engineers to join our growing team in Abuja. We’re looking for highly skilled professionals with over 10 years of hands-on experience in real estate and construction projects.
	Candidates must be COREN certified and possess a strong background in structural designs, project supervision, and site coordination.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage end-to-end construction projects from design to execution.
	Review and validate structural designs and drawings.
	Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress and ensure adherence to design specifications, safety standards, and quality control.
	Supervise contractors, subcontractors, and labor teams to ensure timely delivery of projects.
	Prepare technical reports, BOQs, and cost estimates.
	Liaise with architects, quantity surveyors, and project managers to align project objectives and resolve issues.
	Ensure strict compliance with COREN, Nigerian building codes, and industry best practices.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering from a recognized institution.
	Minimum of 10 years of post-graduation working experience in construction or real estate.
	COREN certification is mandatory.
	Proficiency in structural design software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, STAAD Pro, etc.).
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Proven track record of successfully completed commercial or residential building projects.
	Applicant must be resident in FCT, Abuja.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@salespeoplenigerialtd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Export Manager",
  "description": "AAVA Brands Limited, a new generation company of Chanrai Summit Group (Fareast Mercantile Co. Limited), has been proudly serving Nigeria since 1890 and connects world-class brands to the Nigerian consumer, every day. Now under the umbrella of DP World, AAVA Brands Limited is further strengthened as a flexible and agile service provider. Keeping pace with the evolving needs of African consumers, we strive harder to make the right products available at the right place, in the right time.

We have dedicated our resources to supply chain management through the import / manufacture and distribution of products covering branded Food, Beverages and Fast Moving Consumer Goods for the best multi-nationals in the world. A product portfolio spanning 3,500 SKUs is managed by capable, professional teams, robust infrastructure, and strong delivery systems to ensure availability to consumers every day. As a socially responsible group, we have partnered with various NGOs such as the Tulsi Chanrai Foundation to support their social welfare initiatives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Export Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Export Manager to oversee and manage all export operations within our company.
	The role involves ensuring efficient shipment processing, smooth coordination with stakeholders, and maintaining high service levels for clients.


Key Responsibilites


	Manage and coordinate all export shipments, ensuring smooth operations from booking to final delivery.
	Ensure compliance with international shipping laws, customs regulations, and company policies.
	Manage documentation processes (Bill of Lading, Airway Bill, Commercial Invoice, Packing List, Certificate of Origin, etc.).
	Collaborate with clearing officers, shipping lines, and transporters for seamless cargo movement.
	Provide clients with timely shipment updates and maintain excellent service levels.
	Negotiate rates and contracts with carriers and logistics partners.
	Analyse export performance and implement process improvements.
	Maintain accurate records for audits and compliance.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain, or a related field.
	Proven experience in export/logistics management.
	Strong knowledge of customs regulations, shipping documentation, and international trade laws.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and problem-solving skills.

Export Manager Job at AAVA Brands Limited




        
    

        
        AAVA Brands Limited, a new generation company of Chanrai Summit Group (Fareast Mercantile Co. Limited), has been proudly serving Nigeria since 1890 and connects world-class brands to the Nigerian consumer, every day. Now under the umbrella of DP World, AAVA Brands Limited is further strengthened as a flexible and agile service provider. Keeping pace with the evolving needs of African consumers, we strive harder to make the right products available at the right place, in the right time.
     

            
    



We have dedicated our resources to supply chain management through the import / manufacture and distribution of products covering branded Food, Beverages and Fast Moving Consumer Goods for the best multi-nationals in the world. A product portfolio spanning 3,500 SKUs is managed by capable, professional teams, robust infrastructure, and strong delivery systems to ensure availability to consumers every day. As a socially responsible group, we have partnered with various NGOs such as the Tulsi Chanrai Foundation to support their social welfare initiatives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Export Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Export Manager to oversee and manage all export operations within our company.
	The role involves ensuring efficient shipment processing, smooth coordination with stakeholders, and maintaining high service levels for clients.


Key Responsibilites


	Manage and coordinate all export shipments, ensuring smooth operations from booking to final delivery.
	Ensure compliance with international shipping laws, customs regulations, and company policies.
	Manage documentation processes (Bill of Lading, Airway Bill, Commercial Invoice, Packing List, Certificate of Origin, etc.).
	Collaborate with clearing officers, shipping lines, and transporters for seamless cargo movement.
	Provide clients with timely shipment updates and maintain excellent service levels.
	Negotiate rates and contracts with carriers and logistics partners.
	Analyse export performance and implement process improvements.
	Maintain accurate records for audits and compliance.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain, or a related field.
	Proven experience in export/logistics management.
	Strong knowledge of customs regulations, shipping documentation, and international trade laws.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and problem-solving skills.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
